meanings.definition: To cause worry or distress to someone.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm befretted the scared puppy.
meanings.sent2: She always befretted about her upcoming exams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel befretted the garden gnome by stealing its hat.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds befretted the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house befretted the brave explorer.

meanings.definition: The act of worrying or distressing someone.
meanings.sent1: His constant befretting about the future was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The befretting of the children kept the teacher busy.
meanings.sent3: The befretting of the cat over the missing toy was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The befretting of the old clock echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The befretting of the storm on the fragile boat was palpable.
